comment: I believe this professor feels he has something to prove. Conducts his class/ dishes out course material which is essentially just busy work as if he believes he is the only class his students have. He's unclear about what his expectations are and grades from his point of view instead of on a proper grading scale. Avoid this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He is very knowledgeable and interesting when he actually teaches. Most classes he doesn't teach, and just simply has EVERY SINGLE STUDENT say one thing they found interesting in the reading. The busy work is far too much, with over 20 meaningless reading summaries due during the semester. I've had him for 3 classes, all the same, all bad. Avoid.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: I honestly liked Kperogi a lot the first time I took him. He was soft-spoken but smart as a whip and I felt he was only asking for things that made sense. However, in my recent course, I had an A until the LAST minute when he gave us a meaningless final that tanked my grade and I also couldn't get published. Needs to adjust his grading criteria.
Dr. Kperogi is a great professor. The class itself is somewhat difficult, but as long as you come to class, and finish the assignments on time you shouldn't have any issues.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: One of the worst professors I've ever had. He's incredibly rude when you email him or ask for feedback. Said I plagiarized when I turned in an essay that was completely my work and gave me a C. Does not care even a little about his students. Do not take him!
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Legitimately the worst course I've taken at KSU. Busywork in excess, no meaningful class time despite mandatory attendance, no feedback despite expecting us to get our work published. Additionally, I was caring for my father due to some medical issues, and since that didn't fit in one of his listed excused absences on the syllabus, I lost points.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Attendance is mandatory, but the entire class would be students talking about what they read in the book. We would go up and down the rows having to state new facts that we read that another student hadn't already addressed. Especially difficult with social anxiety. No time spent teaching + Professor has no problem humiliating other students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: The entire semester we read from a book that taught us more than he did because he simply didn't teach. Class periods are used ONLY for EACH and EVERY student to discuss what they read from the chapter. He was extremely rude to one of my peers. He has irrational grading criteria and unrealistic expectations. Busy work that's worth NOTHING. 0/10.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: So Im still taking this class, and honestly Im doing fine because Im in top of my assignments. My main issue with the professor is his tone. Theres something seriously unpleasant about it, and it is concerning especially because its unwarranted.

comment: Just run the opposite way. He doesnt teach anything. You can just buy the book thats required and read that. Youll learn the same thing. comment: This class was easily the most useless class I have taken. Everything we discussed had been taught by other professors. Also, he did NOT teach. comment: Dr. Kperogi is AWESOME! His feedback is so helpful. Each week has quizzes and discussions with one final paper that he has you submit in pieces, which he offers feedback on before your final submission. He is quick to respond to emails and very helpful, but most of all is SO knowledgable about his subject. I loved his class! Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Clear grading criteria

comment: His assignments and grading criteria were unclear, at best. The entire semester leads up to a research paper that has loose guidelines. I would not take the professor again. comment: Good luck, I will never recommend this professor to anyone. His grading is ridiculous.

comment: Hes actually a good teacher ! Took him for the summer and he was a easy grader. He is funny and caring. He is strict for when it comes to rules like attendance so follow them ! And make sure you pick great group members that will actually do work !

comment: Very into himself and does not really allow students to give feedback without him having to give his opinion. Wants the class to be a seminar type, however he is always the only one taking and then he complains that no one wants to participate.

Dr. Kperogi is very difficult and sometimes harsh with his criticism. He is also very organized so expect everything to be laid out in his syllabus and handouts. You WILL get points off if you do not adhere to his instructions on his handouts. Expect lots of feedback on your drafts.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Tests? Not many--Clear grading criteria

comment: Do not take his class unless you're prepared to catch nothing but attitude. The class seems easy but all of his assignments are too broad but he grades hard!!? He DOESNT like to answer your questions on anything and tells you to refer to the syllabus, and even there the directions are still too vague. Made us buy the book and only used it once.

comment: Professor Kperogi can be rude and arrogant, but he knows his stuff. He was frustrating to learn from because he always has to be right, and wants really specific criteria in his assignments. He grades pretty tough, and be prepared to have to attend events to cover for your news stories. He's not the nicest guy, but the course work is doable.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is VERY unclear about the assignments and when you ask him about it he tells you to check the syllabus which is also VAGUE. He's low-key rude, and has to ALWAYS be right. Ask as many questions as you can in as many way possible because its like talking to a brick wall with this professor. Overall avoid taking him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Really nice and empathetic. Took him for a junemester and made an A. I personally didn't need the book I just studied the powerpoints and still did very well. DO OUTLINE FOR GROUP PRESENTATION AND HAND IT IN BEFORE YOU PRESENT. He almost wantedto give us 50s on our presentation for not having it but he was nice enough to let that pass. Take him!

He is not a very good teacher. He is often unclear in his expectations for assignments due to lack of a rubric& his accent. He is also friendly in person, but a little rude online. Once, I emailed him asking him for assistance he offered in class and was told that a "thank you" was in order. Other than that, the class is simple. Just do the work!

Dr. Kperogi is a good professor and knows a lot but he gives so many assignments that you begin to hate him. Current events due every single class, 5 AP style quizzes, and lots of news stories due. He isn't very good at clearly explaining assignments, I felt like I was winging everything. Really nice guy but I would not take him again.

I took Dr. Kperogi as a maymester and he definitely made it worth the while. Take him!! Very nice guy and keeps it light and interesting. Just actively take notes in class and read the powerpoints before tests and quizzes and you'll do great! Take him for a maymester!

As everyone here has said, Professor Kperogi is an asset to the communication department. I was never interested in becoming a journalist when I took his class. But the depth of his knowledge and the passion with with he shared it made me fall in love with journalism. He LOVES his students and CARES for their success. He is hard to please, though.

This is probably the best professor in the communication department! He is highly intelligent, knowledgeable, well-read yet not arrogant. He makes every student feel important. Even if you say BS in response to a question, he would find a way to make the response seem smart and relevant to class discussion. And, oh, he knows A LOT about grammar!

Prof Kperogi is excellent. The class is about new & social media. Blogs due like every 2 weeks. Easy and fun. Present them in class. 1 group presentation. He gives you the ppt online and a study guide. Easy test if you fill out study guide. He loves input from the class during the discussions. Very easy extra credit opportunities too!

this is my 2nd time taking dr. kperogi. lectures are LONG. 3 article assignments (you have to interview for them and everything. it was super stressful), 2 tests, 5 ap style quizzes, current event assignment due every week (just finding articles and sharing with the class).. i didn't bother with the book at all. would recommend.
Second class taken with him, second review posted. A great teacher. Expect to cover current events for the first 30-45 minutes of class.

2 tests, 2 papers, 1 presentation, 2 pnt HW (50 total) , participationattendance. It's not his fault, the class in general is just hideously boring. Everyday we learn a new theory, i.e. just new terms to memorize for test. We went through almost every single chapter in the textbook, so tedious. HW: 2 questions at the end of every chapter every day

Hands down the best professor I have ever had. He is so helpful and makes every person feel important and intelligent; he listens intently to you and cares what you have to say. He makes everything easy and accessible; I had him for a 3000 class and it felt like a beginner course, and I learned a lot. I was so lucky to have him as a professor.
Nice person and tries to keep you interested.

I took this class as a Maymester and found it to be easy. I never read but listened and attended every class and took notes on what he would say in class. You can tell he genuinely cares about his students and encourages class participation. I would take his class again!!!

Great professor! Such a sincere and wonderful soul. He genuinely wants you to do well and gives you all the resources necessary to do so. I did not buy the book but I still made an A. I just supplemented the material with online resources (i.e. Wiki "History of Advertising"). Everything you need to know is on the study guide. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

DR. KPEROGI'S MAYMESTER WAS THE BEST. made a 477/500 in the class. 5 pop quizzes, 4 exams (all curved), attendance/participation, and an easy extra credit. listen during class, take good notes, study your notes (i never looked at the study guides), READ (this is essential!) and you'll do great. TAKE HIS MAYMESTER IF YOU CAN.

He is literally the sweetest man! He curves all of the tests, goes over everything until you get it, posts everything online and gives study guides. I want to take him for everything! Take his class- you won't regret it!

One of the best professors I have had at KSU. He is someone who truly cares for his students. His test are hard but he gives you a study guide way before them so use it. Also attend class and take advantage of the practice writing sessions.

SUCH A NICE GUY! Open to all opinions and comments. Took him for a Junemester and made an A. Gives you what is needed to do well but still study the power points religiously!He curved the tests for our class, not sure if it was because it being a summer class or not. Worth taking. Made a long day of class enjoyable.

Really nice guy! Super helpful. He curves a lot on exams. Take him!! This class is interesting. We talked a lot about social media and watched a lot of YouTube vids! I enjoyed this class. I would take him again!

NICE GUY!!!  Class is interesting if you're into learning about blogs, podcasts, and other new media topics.  Very approachable, funny at times, and gives plenty of time to complete assignments. I learned a lot and would definitely take him again!!
